Package scheduling.schedulingapplication.Model

Class Helper

java.lang.Object
scheduling.schedulingapplication.Model.Helper
public class Helper extends Object
This class creates a Helper class with static helper methods meant to reduce code redundancy, shorten code and improve code readability.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static DateTimeFormatter
    displayFormatterDate
    This static DateTimeFormatter is used to format a time object into a string of standard American date format.
    static DateTimeFormatter
    displayFormatterTime
    This static DateTimeFormatter is used to format a time object into a string of Hour/Minute AM/PM format, with hours going up to 23 hours for clarity when displaying.
    static DateTimeFormatter
    instantToTimeStamp
    This static DateTimeFormatter is used to format a time object into a string that may be passed into TimeStamp's valueOf method.
    static DateTimeFormatter
    timeFormatter
    This static DateTimeFormatter is used to format a time object into string of a standard Hour/Minute AM/PM format.

  • Method Details

    • error

      public static void error(String title, String message)
      This method displays an error alert. This method creates an error alert using the argument strings.
      Parameters:
      title - The error's title.
      message - The error's message.

    • direct

      public static void direct(Class c, String resource, int windowWidth, int windowHeight, String title, EventObject actionEvent)
      This method creates a new scene and directs the program to it. This method uses the parameters to create a new scene and direct to it while centering the screen.
      Parameters:
      c - The class that contains the calling action event, the parent of the new scene.
      resource - The reference path of the FXML file to be loaded and displayed.
      windowWidth - The width of the new scene.
      windowHeight - The height of the new scene.
      title - The title of the new scene.
      actionEvent - The calling action event.

    • getNextCustomerID

      public static int getNextCustomerID()
      This method returns the next available customer ID. The method acquires all customer IDs from the database, adding them to a list. The method then sorts the list and loops through the IDs, returning the first missing ID to be recycled if one is found. If none is found, the method returns a new ID equal to the list size + one.
      Returns:
      Returns the next available customer ID, otherwise returns -1 if a SQL error occurs.

    • getNextAppointmentID

      public static int getNextAppointmentID()
      This method returns the next available appointment ID. The method acquires all appointment IDs from the database, adding them to a list. The method then sorts the list and loops through the IDs, returning the first missing ID to be recycled if one is found. If none is found, the method returns a new ID equal to the list size + one.
      Returns:
      Returns the next available appointment ID, otherwise returns -1 if a SQL error occurs.

    • getDivisionID

      public static int getDivisionID(String division)
      This method takes a division's name as an argument and returns the corresponding division's ID from the database. The method uses a JDBC query to get the corresponding division ID, and then returns it as an int.
      Parameters:
      division - The division's name.
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding division ID from the database, otherwise returns -1 if invalid division name or if a SQL error occurs.

    • getDivision

      public static String getDivision(int divisionID)
      This method takes a division's ID as an argument and returns the corresponding division's name from the database. The method uses a JDBC query to get the corresponding division name, and then returns it as a String.
      Parameters:
      divisionID - The division's ID.
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding division's name from the database, otherwise returns null if invalid division ID or if a SQL error occurs.

    • getCountryDivisions

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getCountryDivisions(int countryID)
      This method takes a country's ID as an argument and returns a list of all the names of the country's divisions. The method uses a JDBC query to get all the names of the country's divisions, then loops through the ResultSet to add them to a list and returns the list.
      Parameters:
      countryID - The country's ID.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all the names of the country's divisions, otherwise returns null if invalid country ID or if a SQL error occurs.

    • getCountryFromDivisionID

      public static String getCountryFromDivisionID(int divisionID)
      This method takes a division's ID as a parameter and returns the name of the division's country. The method uses a JDBC query to get the corresponding country ID from the database, then returns the country's name as a String based on the country ID.
      Parameters:
      divisionID - The division's ID.
      Returns:
      Returns the name of the division's country, otherwise returns null if invalid division ID, or if a SQL error occurs.

    • getCountryID

      public static int getCountryID(String country)
      This method takes a country's name as a parameter and returns the country's ID. The method takes the country's name and then returns the corresponding country ID as an integer.
      Parameters:
      country - The country's name.
      Returns:
      Returns the country's ID, otherwise returns -1 if invalid country name.

    • populateDivisions

      public static void populateDivisions(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> box, String country)
      This method populates a ComboBox with a country's divisions. The method takes a ComboBox of Strings and a country's name as arguments. The method gets the country's ID using the Helper getCountryID method and then passes that ID into the Helper getCountryDivisions method to create a list of all the names of the country's divisions. The method then sets the argument ComboBox's items to the list.
      Parameters:
      box - The ComboBox to be populated with the country's divisions.
      country - The name of the country whose division names are to be set as the ComboBox's items.

    • validateTextField

      public static boolean validateTextField(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField)
      This method checks whether a TextField is empty. The method gets the TextField's text as a String, then checks whether that String is empty.
      Parameters:
      textField - The TextField to be checked.
      Returns:
      Returns true if TextField is not empty, returns false if TextField is empty.

    • getContactName

      public static String getContactName(int contactID)
      This method takes a contact's ID as an argument and returns the corresponding contact's name. The method uses a JDBC query to get the corresponding contact's name from the database, and then returns it as a String.
      Parameters:
      contactID - The contact's ID.
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding contact's name, otherwise returns null if no invalid contact ID or if a SQL error occurs.

    • getContactID

      public static int getContactID(String contactName)
      This method takes a contact's name as an argument and returns the corresponding contact's ID. The method uses a JDBC query to get the corresponding contact's ID and then returns it as an int.
      Parameters:
      contactName - The contact's name.
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding contact's ID, otherwise returns -1 if no invalid contact name or if a SQL error occurs.

    • getAllContacts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getAllContacts()
      This method returns a list of all contacts' names. The method uses a JDBC query to get all contacts' names from the database, then loops through the ResultSet and adds each name to a list. The method then returns the list.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all contacts' names

    • createZonedDateTime

      public static ZonedDateTime createZonedDateTime(LocalDate date, String time)
      This method takes as arguments a LocalDate and a String representing time in a timeFormatter format and creates a corresponding ZonedDateTime in local time zone. The method creates a LocalTime from the time argument String using the timeFormatter DateTimeFormatter, then creates a local time zone ZonedDateTime from the new LocalTime and argument LocalDate. The method then returns this new ZonedDateTime.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to be turned into a ZonedDateTime.
      time - The time to be turned into a ZonedDateTime.
      Returns:
      Returns a local time zone ZonedDateTime object created from the arguments.

    • convertToTimeStampUTC

      public static Timestamp convertToTimeStampUTC(ZonedDateTime dateTime)
      This method takes a ZonedDateTime as an argument and returns a corresponding TimeStamp in UTC time zone. The method converts the argument ZonedDateTime to UTC and uses the instantToTimeStamp DateTimeFormatter to turn it into a string format that can be parsed by TimeStamp's valueOf method. The method then passes the string into Timestamp's valueOf method to turn it into a Timestamp and return it.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - The ZonedDateTime to be turned into a UTC Timestamp.
      Returns:
      Returns a Timestamp corresponding to the ZonedDateTime in UTC.

    • validUserID

      public static boolean validUserID(int userID)
      This method takes a user's ID as an argument and returns true if the user's ID exists within the database, or false if the user's ID does not exist within the database. The method uses a JDBC connection query to get all user IDs from the database, then loops through the ResultSet to check whether the argument user ID exists.
      Parameters:
      userID - The user ID whose existence is to be checked.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the user's ID exists within the database, returns false if the user's ID does not exist within the database.

    • validCustomerID

      public static boolean validCustomerID(int customerID)
      This method takes a customer's ID as an argument and returns true if the customer's ID exists within the database, or false if the customer's ID does not exist within the database. The method uses a JDBC connection query to get all customer IDs from the database, then loops through the ResultSet to check whether the argument customer ID exists.
      Parameters:
      customerID - The customer ID whose existence is to be checked.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the customer's ID exists within the database, returns false if the customer's ID does not exist within the database.

    • customerFKCheck

      public static boolean customerFKCheck(int customerID)
      This method checks whether a customer has any appointments for Foreign Key restriction purposes. The method uses a JDBC connection query to get all appointments' customer IDs, then loops through the ResultSet to check whether any appointment's customer ID matches the argument customer ID.
      Parameters:
      customerID - The customer's ID.
      Returns:
      Returns true if customer has no appointments, returns false if customer has any appointment.

    • filterByCurrentWeek

      public static void filterByCurrentWeek()
      This method sets the static filteredAppointments list's items to all appointments within the current week. The method first clears filteredAppointments, then uses the current date/time to get the first and last day of the current week, then loops through the static allAppointments list to add to filteredAppointments any appointment within the current week.

    • filterByCurrentMonth

      public static void filterByCurrentMonth()
      This method sets the static filteredAppointments list's items to all appointments within the current month. The method first clears filteredAppointments, then uses the current date/time to get the first and last day of the current month, then loops through the static allAppointments list to add to filteredAppointments any appointment within the current month.

    • inBusinessHours

      public static boolean inBusinessHours(ZonedDateTime appointment)
      This method takes an appointment ZonedDateTime as an argument and checks whether it is within business hours (8AM-10PM ET Monday-Friday). The method converts the appointment time to ET, then checks whether it is during a weekend or outside business hours.
      Parameters:
      appointment - The appointment time to be checked.
      Returns:
      Returns true if it is within ET business hours, returns false if it is outside ET business hours.

    • customerAvailable

      public static boolean customerAvailable(int customerID, int appointmentID, ZonedDateTime newStart, ZonedDateTime newEnd)
      This method takes an appointment's start and end times, as well as a customer's ID as arguments and checks whether the customer already has an appointment within the time frame. The method uses a JDBC connection to get the start and end time of all the customer's appointments from the database. The method then loops though the appointments, converting each appointment's start and end time to ZonedDateTimes at local time zone and checking for conflict with the argument appointment times while ensuring that the appointment being compared is not the same appointment as the one being updated.
      Parameters:
      customerID - The ID of the customer whose availability is to be checked.
      newStart - The proposed appointment's start time.
      newEnd - The proposed appointment's end time.
      Returns:
      Returns true if customer is available within that time frame, returns false if customer is not available within that time frame.

    • contactAvailable

      public static boolean contactAvailable(int contactID, int appointmentID, ZonedDateTime newStart, ZonedDateTime newEnd)
      This method takes an appointment's start and end times, as well as a contact's ID as arguments and checks whether the contact already has an appointment within the time frame. The method uses a JDBC connection to get the start and end time of all the contact's appointments from the database. The method then loops though the appointments, converting each appointment's start and end time to ZonedDateTimes at local time zone and checking for conflict with the argument appointment times while ensuring that the appointment being compared is not the same appointment as the one being updated.
      Parameters:
      contactID - The ID of the contact whose availability is to be checked.
      newStart - The proposed appointment's start time.
      newEnd - The proposed appointment's end time.
      Returns:
      Returns true if contact is available within that time frame, returns false if contact is not available within that time frame.

    • appointmentsSoon

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> appointmentsSoon()
      This method returns a list of appointments happening within 15 minutes of the current time. The method creates a list and loops through allAppointments, adding to the new list any appointments happening within 15 minutes of the current time, while excluding any past appointments.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of appointments happening within 15 minutes of the current time.

    • populateTypes

      public static void populateTypes(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> box)
      This method populates a ComboBox with all current appointment types. The method creates a list of Strings, then uses a JDBC connection query to get all appointment types. The method loops through the ResultSet to add to the list any appointment type not already in the list. The method then sets the argument ComboBox's items to the list.
      Parameters:
      box - The ComboBox to be populated.

    • populateMonths

      public static void populateMonths(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> box)
      This method populates a ComboBox with a list of 13 months, starting from the current month and ending with the same month a year from the current date. The method uses the current date to format the current month and the next 12 months into strings of format "MONTH Year" (ex: DECEMBER 2023), adding each String to a list. The method then sets the argument ComboBox's items to the list.
      Parameters:
      box - The ComboBox to be populated.

    • getAllCustomers

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getAllCustomers()
      This method returns of list of all current customer names in the database. The method uses a JDBC connection query to get all customer names from the database, then loops through the ResultSet to add each name to a list. The method then returns the list.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all current customer names as Strings.

    • getCustomerName

      public static String getCustomerName(int id)
      This method takes a customer's ID as an argument and returns the corresponding name. The method uses a JDBC connection query to get the corresponding name from the database, then returns it.
      Parameters:
      id - The customer's ID.
      Returns:
      Returns the customer's name, otherwise returns null if no invalid customer ID or if a SQL error occurs
